name: Purchased goods and services
Emissions calculation methodology: Emissions from our total consumption of fishfeed. Emissionfactors used for each supplier 2018 are: Biomar 1,45 kgCO2e/kg, Ewos 1,382 kgCO2e/kg, Skretting 1,79 kgCO2e/kg.
explanation: All emissions from fishfeed consumption are included.

name: Capital goods
explanation: The emissions from the category of Capital goods are not considered to be relevant for Grieg Seafood 2018 due to a low estimated proportion of emissions, but will be considered if annual capital goods increase considerable from one year to the next.

name: Fuel-and-energy-related activities
Emissions calculation methodology: These are Well-to-tank emissions (WTT) from fuels and energy consumption. The emission factors used to calculate this are; Diesel WTT 0,62564 kgCO2e/liter, Diesel (B5) 0,61 kgCO2e/liter, Biodiesel WTT 0,31295 kgCO2e/liter, Petrol 0,59585 kgCO2e/liter, MGO 740,7 kgCO2e/tonne and Propane/Butane WTT 0,19102 kgCO2e/liter from reference DEFRA 2018. The emission factors for Electricity WTT Nordic mix is 0,029 kgCO2e/kWh with reference NVE/IEA 2012-2015 3 years rolling average, and for Electricity Canada WTT 0,02395 kgCO2e/kWh and Electricity UK WTT 0,04198 kgCO2e/kWh with reference to DEFRA 2018.
explanation: Includes all fuels and electricity consumption.

name: Upstream transportation and distribution
explanation: The emissions from Upstream transportation and distribution are not considered as relevant for Grieg Seafood as they are mainly related to Fishfeed transportation and transportation of fuels that we consume, which is calculated in purchased goods and services.

name: Waste generated in operations
Emissions calculation methodology: These are emissions from generation of waste with reference Ecoinvent. Here the emission factors used are 0,032 kgCO2e/kg for sorted waste and 0,502 kgCO2e for incinerated waste.
explanation: The data for generated waste also includes fish waste from the different sites.

name: Business travel
Emissions calculation methodology: Emission factor for Air travel is reported per region with DEFRA2018 as reference: Intercontinental 0,11237 kgCO2e/pkm, Continental 0,08584 kgCO2e/pkm, Domestic 0,15777 kgCO2e/pkm. Mileage allowance for Norway is 0,144 kgCO2e/km with reference to OFV 2018, and Canada and UK are 0,18064 kgCO2e/km with reference to DEFRA2018.
explanation: Includes air travel and mileage allowance.

name: Employee commuting
explanation: The estimated emissions from employee commuting are very low and hence not relevant for Grieg Seafood compared to the other sources of emissions.

name: Upstream leased assets
explanation: Grieg Seafood does not have any upstream leased assets and does therefore not consider emissions from this category as relevant.

name: Downstream transportation and distribution
Emissions calculation methodology: Includes emissions from downstream transportation by air and road. Emission factor source is DEFRA 2018 where emission factors are; Truck with trailer >33t is 0,08348 kgCO2e/tkm, air continental freight is 1,02929 kgCO2e/tkm and air intercontinental freight is 0,65135 kgCO2e/tkm.
explanation: The emissions include all transportation by air as well as transport by road from our locations to the country the product is sold to for all of Grieg Seafoods locations. The calculation currently excludes emissions from transportation of our products to the airport, however we will work more closely with the goods transporting services to provide these numbers as well in the future.

name: Processing of sold products
explanation: The emissions from Processing of sold products are evaluated as not relevant for Grieg Seafood by now, because the emissions from this category are considered to be lowcompared to the other sources of emissions.

name: Use of sold products
explanation: The emissions from the category of Use of sold products is not considered as relevant to Grieg Seafood, our sector nor business model. There are no emissions because our products are not used, and the consumption does not include emissions.

name: End of life treatment of sold products
explanation: The emissions from End of life treatment of sold products are not considered as relevant to Grieg Seafood, neither our sector or business model, since we consider these to be minimal.

name: Downstream leased assets
explanation: Grieg Seafood does not have any downstream leased assets, and does therefore not consider the emissions from this category as relevant.

name: Franchises
explanation: Grieg Seafood does not have any franchises, and does therefore not consider this category as relevant.

name: Investments
explanation: The category of Investments is not considered as relevant for Grieg Seafood, as all the investments are included elsewhere in our carbon accounting.

name: Other (upstream)
explanation: Other Upstream emissions are not considered relevant to Grieg Seafood, our sector nor business model.

name: Other (downstream)
explanation: Other Downstream emissions are not considered relevant to Grieg Seafood, our sector nor business model.
